item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 100 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Live Updates

Introduction

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has entered its final day of bidding, with high demand as it has been oversubscribed. Investors are urged to apply before the deadline.

Key Points

  • The IPO is subscribed over 100 times, with a total of 85 million shares traded compared to 840,000 shares on offer.
  • Price band set at ₹204 to ₹215, aiming to raise ₹260.15 crore.
  • Approximately 52.16% of revenue comes from tractors; risk factors include demand fluctuations.
  • Valuation appears expensive at a P/E ratio of 51.81 compared to the industry average.
  • Industry outlook shows significant growth in the tractor and crane markets over the coming years.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“Indo Farm Equipment IPO was subscribed 100.42 times so far.”

Conclusion

Given the strong oversubscription rate and growth potential, the Indo Farm Equipment IPO presents a compelling opportunity for long-term investors, particularly those open to higher risks.

item.title: CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on this MFIN decision - CNBCTV18
item.description:
CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on this MFIN decision

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

On January 2, 2025, stocks in the microfinance segment, such as CreditAccess Grameen and Spandana Sphoorty, saw gains of up to 9% after the MicroFinance Institute Network (MFIN) announced a three-month delay in the implementation of new lending caps.

  • Microfinance stocks gained after MFIN's announcement.
  • The MFIN delay allows more time for lenders managing their stress and delinquencies.
  • New lending caps will now be implemented by April 1, 2025.
  • Industries related to microfinance were under stress, with overdues on the rise.
  • Shares of CreditAccess Grameen rose 9.3% to ₹973.55, while Spandana Sphoorty increased by 2.5% to ₹337.3.
“Microfinance overdues are up 110 basis points on a month-on-month basis in November 2024,” - UBS report.

In conclusion, the MFIN's decision to delay the caps offers relief to microfinance companies amidst rising defaults and stress in the sector.

item.title: Gold rate today nudges higher as investors await US data for US Fed rate cut cues. US inflation in focus | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Gold Rate Today: Investors Anticipate US Economic Data for Fed Rate Cut Insights

Date: Today
Source: Live Mint

The gold rate experienced a rise in early morning trading as investors await US economic data for insights on potential Federal Reserve rate cuts. The MCX gold rate opened at ₹77,000 per 10 gm, reflecting a notable increase in international gold prices.

Key Points:

  • The gold price reached an intraday high of ₹77,074 today.
  • Spot gold is trading at approximately $2,632 per troy ounce.
  • Market observers noted a buying interest influenced by weakness in the US dollar.
  • Analyst Kyle Rodda predicts a bullish trend in gold prices driven by geopolitical risks and expectations of rising government debt.
  • The markets currently see an 11.2% chance of a Fed rate cut in January 2025.
  • Investors are advised to consider economic data on inflation before making investment decisions.
“Chances of the US Fed rate cut are looking weak after the December 2024 US Fed meeting as the US inflation still exceeds 2 percent.” – Anuj Gupta, HDFC Securities

This rise in gold prices reflects market expectations of future rate cuts, but inflation concerns lead to caution among investors.

item.title: New Honda SUV Spotted Testing! Launching Soon! - MotorOctane
item.description:
New Honda SUV Spotted Testing! Launching Soon!

Date: January 1, 2025
Source: MotorOctane

Honda has been seen testing its upcoming Elevate SUV, showcasing a new Black Edition that features a bold black exterior and interior design.

  • Honda's Elevate SUV has been successful, and the new Black Edition aims to enhance its appeal.
  • The Elevate Black Edition will have an all-black theme, including body work and alloys.
  • Expect cosmetic changes like a smoked effect on lights and a new badge.
  • Mechanically, it will retain the 1.5-litre NA petrol i-VTEC engine with 119 bhp.
  • Launching soon with a small price premium for the new edition.
“With this new look, the SUV will be able to fetch more attention in the country.”

In conclusion, the new Honda Elevate Black Edition is set to launch soon, promising to attract attention and potentially boost sales for Honda.

item.title: Stock Split, Bonus Issue: TWIN TREAT for shareholders; RECORD DATE in January - ET Now
item.description:
Stock Split, Bonus Issue: TWIN TREAT for shareholders; RECORD DATE in January

Updated: January 2, 2025, Source: ET NOW News

BN Rathi Securities has announced a stock split and bonus issue, rewarding shareholders with significant corporate actions.

  • Shareholders will receive one bonus share for every existing share held.
  • The stock will split in a 1:2 ratio, reducing face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5.
  • Record date for eligibility is set for January 24, 2025.
  • The stock has delivered an all-time return of 8,526% since May 2004.
  • Currently, shares are trading at Rs 249.95, down by 5.73%.
"Issue of Bonus Shares in the ratio of 1:1, i.e., 1 new fully paid-up equity share of Rs. 5/- each for every 1 existing fully paid-up equity share of Rs. 5/- each held by them," said the company.

This announcement reflects BN Rathi Securities' commitment to enhancing shareholder value and adapting to market dynamics.

item.title: December Auto Sales: Ashok Leyland shares rise as December 2024 sales beat estimates - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Ashok Leyland Shares Rise as December 2024 Sales Beat Estimates

Publication Date: January 2, 2025   Source: CNBC-TV18

Ashok Leyland reported impressive December sales figures, surpassing estimates and leading to an increase in share prices.

  • Total sales increased by 5% year-on-year.
  • Medium and Heavy Commercial Vehicles (M&HCVs) sales rose by 8%.
  • Total sales reached 16,957 units, exceeding the estimated 16,600 units.
  • M&HCV sales were reported at 11,474 units.
  • Light Commercial Vehicle (LCV) sales decreased by 1%.
  • Truck sales increased by 11%, while bus sales dropped by 3%.
“Inflation and higher commodity prices have necessitated this price increase. This move will help mitigate a part of the input cost impact.” - Ashok Leyland

The strong sales figures are a positive sign for Ashok Leyland as it prepares for a potential price increase across its commercial vehicle range in 2025.

item.title: Don't Miss Out! Air India Express New Year Sale. Flight ticket fares starting from just ₹1,448 | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Don’t Miss Out! Air India Express New Year Sale. Flight ticket fares starting from just ₹1,448

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Live Mint

Air India Express has introduced a New Year Sale featuring flight fares as low as ₹1,448, available for bookings until January 5, for travel between January 8 and September 20, 2025.

  • Fares start at ₹1,448 under the Lite offer and ₹1,599 under the Value offer.
  • The Lite Offer is exclusive to logged-in loyalty members on the airline’s website or mobile app.
  • Included in the fare are base fare, taxes, and airport charges, but not convenience fees.
  • NeuCoins will be credited post-journey, based on passenger details matching government IDs.
  • Offers are subject to availability and cannot be canceled for a full refund.
  • Air India Express reserves the right to modify or terminate the offer at any time without notice.
“The Airline reserves the right to cancel, terminate, or suspend the Offer with or without any prior notice and reason,” Air India Express stated.

In conclusion, this promotional sale offers an opportunity for budget-conscious travelers to secure affordable flights in advance, though with certain terms and conditions.

item.title: Prajakta Koli opens up about consequences of extreme dieting, reveals her weight loss secrets: 'I tried...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prajakta Koli Discusses Extreme Dieting and Her Weight Loss Journey

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prajakta Koli shares her experience with extreme dieting, admitting it led her to poor health. She emphasizes the importance of balance in her fitness journey.

  • Prajakta Koli reveals she tried a strict diet once but became clinically sick.
  • She has gained muscle while losing fat, leading to a healthier state.
  • Her weight loss secret is not dieting but exercising regularly.
  • She maintains her health through home-cooked meals and hydration.
  • Prajakta stresses mental health is tied to physical fitness.
“I cannot diet; food makes me too happy, I cannot leave it.”

In conclusion, Prajakta advocates for a balanced approach to fitness that prioritizes overall well-being over restrictive dieting.

item.title: Jefferies expects this stock to rise 55%; bets on power, defence names - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Jefferies predicts this stock to rise 55%; bets on power, defence names

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBCTV18

Global brokerage firm Jefferies highlights power and defense sectors as key areas for investment, with top stock picks being Siemens, HAL, Thermax, and L&T.

  • HAL has a 'Buy' rating with a projected price target of ₹5,500, indicating a 32% potential upside.
  • Thermax also holds a 'Buy' with a target of ₹6,100, implying a 55% potential rise.
  • L&T is rated 'Buy' with a target price of ₹4,600, showing a 25% upside potential.
  • Siemens is expected to benefit from improvements in its Power T&D division.
  • Jefferies' 2025 Industrials outlook reflects contrasting growth expectations amid political changes.
“BJP's victory in the Maharashtra elections has alleviated some investor concerns.”

The analysis indicates that Jefferies remains optimistic about the outlook for key players in the power and defense sectors despite recent uncertainties in the market.

item.title: Kunal Kamra asks Blinkit CEO to reveal wages of delivery partners, says quick commerce exploits gig workers - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kunal Kamra Criticizes Quick Commerce for Exploiting Gig Workers

Jan 02, 2025 - Hindustan Times

Comedian Kunal Kamra has criticized quick commerce platforms for exploiting gig workers, highlighting the dark side of convenience. These platforms, such as Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart, and Zepto, deliver groceries and other household goods to customers' doorsteps in minutes. However, Kamra points out the unfair wages and long working hours of gig workers in the industry.

Key Points:

  • Kamra criticized quick commerce platforms for low wages and long hours of gig workers.
  • He specifically targeted Blinkit CEO Albinder Dhindsa, asking him to reveal the average wages of delivery partners.
  • Kamra likened the CEOs of these companies to 'thugs' for exploiting gig workers without proper regulations.
  • Social media users supported Kamra's views, with many agreeing that these platforms exploit workers.
"They are thugs that are using data as oil without paying for the oil fields. Someday there will be regulation that humbles them..." - Kunal Kamra

Kamra's post has gathered over 1.9 lakh views with widespread support from other social media users.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 2: Telecom stocks, Tata Motors, RailTel, CSB Bank, NMDC, Indian Bank and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to watch, January 2: Telecom stocks, Tata Motors, RailTel, CSB Bank, NMDC, Indian Bank and more

Date: January 2, 2025

Source: Financial News

NIFTY50 and SENSEX are expected to start in the negative territory as GIFT NIFTY shows a slight decline. Key stocks to monitor include NMDC, Tata Motors, and major Telecom companies, with various updates reflecting production and revenue changes.

  • NMDC: Iron-ore production rose by 5% to 4.71 million tonnes (MT) but sales dropped from 4.19 MT to 3.91 MT.
  • Tata Motors: Domestic sales increased by 1% to 76,599 units; passenger vehicle sales also grew by 1%.
  • Telecom Sector: Revenue surged 10.5% YoY to ₹91,426 crore; major players hiked mobile service rates significantly.
  • RailTel: Awarded a work order worth ₹78.43 crore with a completion deadline of August 28, 2025.
  • CSB Bank: Gross advances grew by 26.45% to ₹28,914 crore.
  • Indian Bank: New appointments follow the retirement of the CEO.
  • India Cements: New CEO and CFO appointments effective January 1.
"The gross revenue of telecom operators surged... Airtel, Jio, and Vodafone Idea hiked their mobile service rates by 11% to 25%." - Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI)

The markets begin the day with significant key indicators and company performance updates that may influence stock strategies.

item.title: NEFT, RTGS update: RBI introduces name lookup facility to verify beneficiaries | Know details | Mint - Mint
item.description:
NEFT, RTGS update: RBI introduces name lookup facility to verify beneficiaries

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is implementing a new facility that allows remitters to verify the beneficiary's account name before transferring funds via NEFT and RTGS. This aims to reduce incorrect money transfers and enhance user confidence.

  • The RBI will enable a name lookup facility for NEFT and RTGS systems.
  • This facility will help prevent incorrect transactions by verifying beneficiary names.
  • It is similar to existing features in UPI and IMPS systems that allow name verification.
  • The facility will be available through internet and mobile banking, as well as in branches.
  • All banks are required to implement this by April 1, 2025.
“Remitters can input the account number and the branch IFSC code of the beneficiary, following which the name of the beneficiary will be displayed.” - RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das

The introduction of this facility is expected to significantly improve the accuracy of electronic fund transfers and enhances customer trust in the systems.

item.title: Wipro shares downgraded by CLSA just six months after a 'double upgrade' - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Wipro shares downgraded by CLSA just six months after a 'double upgrade'

Date: Not Provided

Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm CLSA has downgraded Wipro Ltd’s shares from "outperform" to "hold" just six months after issuing a double upgrade, reflecting changes in market performance and expectations.

  • CLSA maintains a price target of ₹303, nearly the same as the current closing price.
  • The downgrade comes as Wipro shares have outperformed in recent months, increasing 3% in the last month and 14% since July last year.
  • Analysts predict Wipro will remain sluggish, forecasting flat Constant Currency growth for the December quarter.
  • Wipro has seen a 1% earnings downgrade for 2024, despite a price-to-earnings ratio increase from 19.7x to 24.4x.
  • Out of 45 analysts, 25 recommend selling, 9 recommend buying, and 11 suggest holding the stock.
"The next leg of re-rating for Wipro can happen only if it starts growing in-line with its other largecap peers." - CLSA

Overall, Wipro's stock performance remains cautious while the firm awaits its upcoming earnings report.

item.title: Intraday stocks for today under ₹100: Experts recommend four shares to buy today — 2 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Intraday Stocks Under ₹100: Four Shares Recommended by Experts for 2 January 2025

Date: 2 January 2025 Source: Live Mint

Introduction: On the first trading day of 2025, the Indian stock market showed positive momentum, with key indices closing higher. Market experts have provided recommendations for intraday stocks under ₹100.

Key Points:

  • The Nifty 50 index ended 98 points higher, reaching 23,742.
  • The BSE Sensex increased by 435 points, closing at 78,574.
  • Experts recommended four stocks: IFCI, South Indian Bank, Balaji Telefilms, and Confidence Petroleum.
  • The market outlook remains cautious, with foreign institutional investors (FIIs) selling significant amounts of equities.

Notable Quotes:

“Technically, the Bank Nifty index held its 200-day Exponential moving average and closed above trend line support.” - Hrishikesh Yedve
“We expect markets to remain sideways until the start of the Q3 result announcements.” - Siddhartha Khemka

Conclusion: The market's strength is evident, but the cautious stance due to foreign selling suggests traders should remain vigilant. Those looking for intraday opportunities might consider the stocks highlighted by the experts.

item.description:
Top Stock Picks for 2025: Axis Securities Highlights 16 Names with Up to 40% Upside

Date & Source: March 3, 2024, CNBC-TV18

Axis Securities has released its list of top stock picks for 2025, featuring 16 names with potential upsides ranging from 10% to 40%. The list includes a mix of largecap, midcap, and smallcap stocks.

  1. ICICI Bank: +17% (Buy, ₹1,500 price target)
  2. SBI: +31% (Buy, ₹1,040 price target)
  3. Varun Beverages: +10% (Buy, ₹700 price target)
  4. HDFC Bank: +14% (Buy, ₹2,025 price target)
  5. Bharti Airtel: +18% (Buy, ₹1,880 price target)
  6. Cholamandalam Investment: +41% (Buy, ₹1,675 price target)
  7. HCLTech: +10% (Buy, ₹2,110 price target)
  8. Aurobindo Pharma: +15% (Buy, ₹1,500 price target)
  9. Lupin: +10% (Buy, ₹2,600 price target)
  10. Dalmia Bharat: +15% (Buy, ₹2,040 price target)
  11. Prestige Estates: +30% (Buy, ₹2,195 price target)
  12. Chalet Hotels: +10% (Buy, ₹1,075 price target)
  13. Sansera Engineering: +19% (Buy, ₹1,780 price target)
  14. Healthcare Global: +18% (Buy, ₹575 price target)
  15. Gravita India: +38% (Buy, ₹3,000 price target)
  16. J Kumar Infra: +25% (Buy, ₹950 price target)

Source: CNBC-TV18

item.title: Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50 to global markets; 5 stocks to buy or sell on Thursday — 2 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Nifty 50 and Global Markets Outlook: 5 Stock Picks for Thursday, January 2, 2025

Date & Source: January 2, 2025, Live Mint

Introduction: The first trading day of 2025 ended positively with the Nifty 50 index gaining 0.41% and the S&P BSE Sensex up by 0.47%. Bank Nifty also saw gains of 0.39%.

  1. The Nifty 50 index rebounded to ₹23,742.90 levels with immediate resistance at 23,870 and support at 23,537.
  2. Bank Nifty is expected to trade within the 50,500–52,000 range, with a breakout in either direction determining its future direction.
  3. The market started positively on the first day of 2025, with broad-based recovery aided by positive earnings growth expectations and an uptick in core sector data.
  4. Five stocks have been recommended for buying or selling by experts.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

"The market started positively on the first day of 2025... An uptick in core sector data and the prospect of a ramp-up in capex spending by the government in the remaining part of the fiscal aided sectors like capital goods, industrials, auto, and power." - Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services

Conclusion: The article provides an overview of the first trading day of 2025, the outlook for global markets, and expert recommendations for five stocks based on technical analysis.
